intro: Warneckea membranifolia, commonly known as the paperleaf warneckea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, thin, and papery leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Warneckea membranifolia is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance and ecological significance.
